ch.epfl.alpano.gui

Enum UserParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UserParameter>
      • ch.epfl.alpano.gui.UserParameter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UserParameter>

    public enum UserParameter
extends java.lang.Enum<UserParameter>
    The enum represents the limits of the userParameter.

    It will offer only one method that will allow the parameter passed to it to be sanitized . When called it will ensure that the value returned is the closest valid value possible.

    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • OBSERVER_LONGITUDE

        public static final UserParameter OBSERVER_LONGITUDE
        Longitude of the observer. Must be contained 6° and 12°.

      • OBSERVER_LATITUDE

        public static final UserParameter OBSERVER_LATITUDE
        Latitude of the observer. Must be contained between 45° and 48°.

      • OBSERVER_ELEVATION

        public static final UserParameter OBSERVER_ELEVATION
        Elevation of the observer. Must be contained between 300m and 10_000m

      • CENTER_AZIMUTH

        public static final UserParameter CENTER_AZIMUTH
        Center Azimuth. Must is between 0° and 359°.

      • HORIZONTAL_FIELD_OF_VIEW

        public static final UserParameter HORIZONTAL_FIELD_OF_VIEW
        Horizontal field of view of the image. Between 1° and 360°.

      • MAX_DISTANCE

        public static final UserParameter MAX_DISTANCE
        Maximum viewing distance. Between 10km and 600km.

      • WIDTH

        public static final UserParameter WIDTH
        Width in pixels of the image. Between 30 pixels and 16_000 pixels.

      • HEIGHT

        public static final UserParameter HEIGHT
        Height in pixels of the image. Between 10 pixels and 4_000 pixels.

      • SUPER_SAMPLING_EXPONENT

        public static final UserParameter SUPER_SAMPLING_EXPONENT
        SuperSampling ratio. Must be either 0, 1, or 2.

      • sanitize

        public int sanitize(int v)
        Will return a value that is within the limits of the computational data that we have available for the panorama.
        Parameters:
        v - The value corresponding to the parameter.
        Returns:
        The closest valid value.
